text:
Alison Pill (born November 27, 1985) is a Canadian actress. She started her career at the age of twelve. In 2006, she was nominated for a Tony Award for Best Featured Actress in a Play for her performance in "The Lieutenant of Inishmore" (2006). Her movies credits include "Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen" (2004), "Plain Truth" (2004), "Milk" (2008), "Scott Pilgrim vs. the World" (2010), "Midnight in Paris" (2011), "Zoom" (2015) and "Vice" (2018). Her TV roles include the series "The Book of Daniel" (2006), "In Treatment" (2009), "The Pillars of the Earth" (2010), "The Newsroom" (2012–14), "American Horror Story" (2017) and ' (2020).
Pill was born in Toronto, Ontario. Her father is Estonian. She married actor Joshua Leonard in 2015. The couple have one child.

annotations.surface_form: Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
